decks.notes: This deck is focused on dealing as much damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. It includes a mix of powerful burn spells and aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent while using cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack to prevent them from gaining life or stabilizing. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to the deck's powerful spells, allowing it to overwhelm the opponent before they can set up a strong defense.

This Golgari Aggro deck is focused on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. The deck also utilizes removal spells like Abrupt Decay, Fatal Push, and Maelstrom Pulse to control the board and protect its threats. Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provide additional disruption and card advantage. The deck's mana base allows for consistent plays and the inclusion of versatile cards like Eternal Witness and Kitchen Finks offer resilience and flexibility in various matchups.

The deck focuses on assembling a creature toolbox to tutor up specific combo pieces. It utilizes cards like Noble Hierarch, Devoted Druid, Vizier of Remedies, and Walking Ballista to generate infinite mana and/or combos. Cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling help find the necessary pieces quickly. The deck also includes utility creatures like Kitchen Finks and Eternal Witness for value. Gavony Township and Renegade Rallier provide additional synergy to enhance the deck's overall strategy. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature synergies and combos.

This Abzan Aggro deck focuses on disruption and removal spells to control the opponent's board while putting pressure with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf, Grim Flayer, and Lingering Souls. The deck also utilizes graveyard synergies with Scavenging Ooze and Kalitas, Traitor of Ghet to gain incremental advantages. Liliana of the Veil provides additional disruption and card advantage. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence to overwhelm them.

The deck focuses on using creatures with low converted mana costs to quickly build a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent. By including cards like Champion of the Parish and Thalia's Lieutenant that benefit from creatures entering the battlefield, as well as cards like Noble Hierarch and Avacyn's Pilgrim to ramp up mana production, the deck aims to establish dominance early in the game. The inclusion of cards like Reflector Mage and Path to Exile also helps to control the opponent's threats while continuing to push for victory through aggressive plays.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck focuses on aggressively playing Death's Shadow to pressure the opponent's life total quickly. The deck includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand, along with efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to deal with threats. Cards like Snapcaster Mage and Kolaghan's Command provide versatility and card advantage. The deck also includes delve creatures like Gurmag Angler and Tasigur, the Golden Fang to deploy threats while filling the graveyard for Death's Shadow.

The main idea of this Lantern Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy by controlling the top of their library. By using cards like Lantern of Insight and Codex Shredder, the player can manipulate what their opponent draws, while also using cards like Ensnaring Bridge to protect themselves from attacks. Other cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek help to disrupt the opponent's hand, while cards like Surgical Extraction and Abrupt Decay can remove key cards from the opponent's graveyard or field. Overall, the deck focuses on control and disruption to win the game.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly and efficiently to cast Scapeshift, which allows the player to fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and enough Mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Primeval Titan to search for specific lands and Sakura-Tribe Elder to accelerate the mana base. The deck also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Roast to handle threats while setting up the combo. Additionally, it runs cards like Sweltering Suns and Thragtusk for board control and life gain.

The main objective of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Ad Nauseam and Angel's Grace to draw the entire deck and win the game with Laboratory Maniac. The deck efficiently ramps up its mana with cards like Lotus Bloom and Pentad Prism, while protecting itself with Leyline of Sanctity and Phyrexian Unlife. Spoils of the Vault is used to find key combo pieces, and Serum Visions and Sleight of Hand help to dig through the deck. Lightning Storm serves as an alternate win condition if needed. This deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using the Death's Shadow archetype. The key strategy is to quickly lower your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow while controlling the opponent's board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate. The deck also utilizes card advantage through spells like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage, while also disrupting the opponent's strategy with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize. The main goal is to apply pressure on the opponent while maintaining control of the game.

The main concept of this deck revolves around quickly filling up the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion. By utilizing Life from the Loam to constantly bring back lands from the graveyard, this deck can generate a lot of value and enables the combo potential of cards like Conflagrate. Using the Dredge mechanic, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a constant stream of threats from the graveyard while also controlling the board with removal spells like Lightning Axe.

The deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly with cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting, then using cards like Life from the Loam to bring back key cards like Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba. The synergy between dredge cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, along with recursive cards like Bloodghast and Haunted Dead, allows for explosive turns and overwhelming board presence. The goal is to quickly assemble a powerful board state and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on playing powerful Eldrazi creatures as quickly as possible by utilizing the Eldrazi Temple and Urza's lands to ramp up mana. It also uses cards like Expedition Map to search for specific lands and Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big and aggressive creatures like Thought-Knot Seer, Reality Smasher, and Walking Ballista. It can also control the board with cards like Dismember and All Is Dust, while also having access to powerful planeswalkers like Karn Liberated.

The main idea of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply early pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. By utilizing powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf, Siege Rhino, Dark Confidant, and Grim Flayer, the deck aims to close out the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize. The deck also includes removal spells such as Fatal Push and Path to Exile to deal with threats on the opponent's side of the board. The inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Liliana, the Last Hope provides additional value and control over the game.

The key concept of this deck is aggressive gameplay with a focus on disruption and resource denial. The deck utilizes a mix of efficient creature threats, disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, and removal options like Fatal Push and Maelstrom Pulse. It also includes cards like Liliana of the Veil and Lingering Souls for long-term value and board control. The goal is to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and maintain card advantage through cards like Dark Confidant and Mishra's Bauble. Overall, the deck aims to control the board while pressuring the opponent's life total.

The deck is focused on assembling a powerful storm combo involving casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate a lethal amount of mana and damage. It includes key cards like Pyretic Ritual, Desperate Ritual, Manamorphose, and Baral, Chief of Compliance to help generate mana and reduce spell costs. The goal is to cast spells like Gifts Ungiven to search for win conditions such as Grapeshot or Empty the Warrens to finish off the opponent in a single explosive turn. The deck aims to efficiently dig through the deck using cantrips like Sleight of Hand and Serum Visions to find combo pieces and ensure consistent combo execution.
